owl:Ontology.dc:creator: Adolfo Antón Bravo (Ontology Engineering Group - Universidad Politécnica de Madrid)
Oscar Corcho (Ontology Engineering Group - Universidad Politécnica de Madrid)
owl:Ontology.dc:description: Module of the Transmodel Ontology focused on journeys. This ontology provides support to the NeTEx model. Visit https://github.com/oeg-upm/transmodel-ontology
owl:Ontology.dc:title: Transmodel Ontology - Journeys
owl:Ontology.rdfs:comment: Module of the Transmodel Ontology focused on facilities. This ontology provides support to the NeTEx model. Visit https://github.com/oeg-upm/transmodel-ontology
owl:Ontology.rdfs:label: Transmodel Ontology - Journeys
owl:Ontology.owl:versionInfo: This is the initial version of the module on Journeys, after considering the UML models and XSD descriptions of Transmodel and NeTEx

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: accessPTS

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:comment: The assignment of operational characteristics, expressed by DayType, to a particular OperatingDay within a ServiceCalendar
owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: dayTypeAssignment
Connection End, one end of a connection in Transmodel v6.0
endsConnection

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:comment: The Journey of a Passenger is a Trip
owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: passengerJourneys

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:comment: A Line is run by an Operator
owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: run By

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:comment: The allocation of a ScheduledStopPoint (i.e. a ScheduledStopPoint of a ServicePattern or JourneyPattern) to a specific StopPlace, for either a ServiceJourney or VehicleService
owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: stopAssignment

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:comment: The Journey of a Vehicle is a VehicleJourney
owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: vehicleJourneys

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: A company providing Public Transport Services. In GTFS, this is represented as a TransitAgency
The class comes from tm-authorities.owl
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Operator

owl:Class.rdfs:comment:
The physical spatial possibility for a passenger to access or leave the public transport system. The link may be used during a Trip for:
- The walking movement of the Passenger from a Place (Origin of the Trip) to a ScheduledStopPoint (origin of the Public Transport Trip). - The walking movement of the Passenger from a Scheduled Stop Point (destination of the Public Transport Trip) to a Place (destination of the Trip)
owl:Class.rdfs:label: TypeOfAccess

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: A characterisation of the passenger movement according to the means of transport different from public transport: walking, own bike,
owl:Class.rdfs:label: AccessMode

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: A Zone for which the duration to cover any Access link to a particular ScheduledStopPoint is the same
owl:Class.rdfs:label: AccessZone

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: The descriptive data associated with a Place that can be used to describe the unique geographical context of a Place for the purposes of identifying. May be refined as either a Road Address, a Postal Address or both.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Address

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: A type of Place to which Passengers may refer to indicate the origin or a destination of a trip and that is so specific that it has an Address.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: AddressablePlace

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: An allowed direction that can be used on a given Route. This can be used to validate the selection of allowed values
owl:Class.rdfs:label: AllowedLineDirections

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: A Point where a beacon or similar device to support the automatic detection of vehicles passing by is located
owl:Class.rdfs:label: BeaconPoint

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: The work of a vehicle from the time it leaves a ParkingPoint after parking until its next retrun to park at a ParkingPoint. Any subsequent departure form a ParkingPoint after parking marks the start of a new Block. The period of a Block must be covered by Duties.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Block

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Part of a Block corresponding to the different JourneyPart of the VehicleJourney in a Block
owl:Class.rdfs:label: BlockPart

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: A location within a Quay from which Passenger may directly board, or onto which passengers may directly alight from a Vehicle
owl:Class.rdfs:label: BoardingPosition

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: The work of a vehicle during the time it is coupled to anohter vehicle
owl:Class.rdfs:label: CompoundBlock

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: The physical (spatial) possibility for a Passenger to change from one public transport vehicle to another to continue the trip, determined by two ScheduledStopPoint. Different times may be necessary to cover the link between these points, depending the kind of Passenger
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Connection

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: A complete journey operated by a coupled train, composed of two or more Vehicle Journeys remaining coupled together all along a Journey Pattern. A Coupled Journey may be viewed as a single VehicleJourney.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: CoupledJourney

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: A part of a Block composed of consecutive VehicleJourneys defined for the same DayType, all operated on the same Line.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: CourseOfJourneys

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: The work of a Vehicle on a particular OperatingDay from the time it leaves a ParkingPoint after parking until its next return to park at a ParkingPoint
owl:Class.rdfs:label: DatedBlock

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: A PassingTime on a particular OperatingDay
owl:Class.rdfs:label: DatedPassingTime

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: A particular Journey of a Vehicle on a particular OperatingDay including all modifications possibly decided by the control staff
owl:Class.rdfs:label: DatedVehicleJourney

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: A particular week day, from Monday to Sunday
owl:Class.rdfs:label: DayOfWeek

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: A DayType is a type of day characterised by one or more properties which affect public transport operation
owl:Class.rdfs:label: DayType

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: A non-service VehicleJourney
owl:Class.rdfs:label: DeadRun

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: A JourneyPattern to be used for DeadRun
owl:Class.rdfs:label: DeadRunPattern

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: The physical (spatial) possibility for a Passenger to change from one public transport Vehicle to another to continue the Trip. It specifies default times to be used to change from one mode of transport to another at an area or national level as specified by a TopographicPlace, Stop Area or SiteElement. It may be restricted to a specific Mode or Operator oe only apply in a particular direction of transfer, e.g. bus to rail may have a different time for rail to bus.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: DefaultConnection

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: A quality parameter fixing the acceptable duration (standard and maximum) for an Interchage to be planned between two ScheduledStopPoint. this parameter will be used to control whether any two VehicleJourney serving those Points may be in connection.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: DefaultInterchange

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: The default time taken by a Vehicle to traverse a TimingLink during a ServiceJourney, for a specified TimeDemandType. This time may be superseded by the JourneyPatternRunTime or VehicleJourneyRunTime if these exist
owl:Class.rdfs:label: DefaultServiceJourneyRunTime

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: A classification for the general orientation of Routes
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Direction

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Specialisation of Line for FlexibleService. As all the service on a Line may not be flexible, flexibility itself is described at JourneyPattern level, meaning that a separate JourneyPattern is needed for each type of flexibility available for the Line
owl:Class.rdfs:label: FlexibleLine

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: A specialisation of Point for FlexibleService
owl:Class.rdfs:label: FlexiblePoint

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Specialisation of Route for FlexibleService. May include both Point and Zonal areas and ordered and unordered sections.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: FlexibleRoute

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: A set of TimingLinks grouped together according to the similarity of TimeBand which are relevant to them. There may be a GroupOfTimingLinks which covers all TimingLinks, for use when different GroupOfTimingLinks are not needed
owl:Class.rdfs:label: GroupOfTimingLink

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: A time interval or a duration defining a headway period and characterizing HeadwayJourneyGroup
owl:Class.rdfs:label: HeadwayInterval

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: A part of a VehicleJourney created according to a specific functional purpose, for instance in situations when Vehicle coupling or separating occurrs
owl:Class.rdfs:label: JourneyPart

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Two JourneyParts of different VehicleJourneys served simultaneously by a train set up by coupling their single Vehicles
owl:Class.rdfs:label: JourneyPartCouple

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: An ordered list of Scheduled Stop Points and Timing Point on a single Route, describing the pattern of working for public transport vehicles. A Journey Pattern may pass through the same Point more than once. The first point of a JourneyPattern is the origin. The last point is the destination.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: JourneyPattern

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: A JourneyPatternLayover is the time allowance at the end of each journey on a specified JourneyPattern to allow for delays and for other purposes. This layover supersedes any global layover and may be superseded by a specific VehicleJourneyLayover
owl:Class.rdfs:label: JourneyPatternLayover

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: The time taken to traverse a TimingLink in a particular JourneyPattern, for a specified TimeDemandType. If it exists, it will override the DefaultServiceJourneyRunTime and DefaultDeadRunRunTime
owl:Class.rdfs:label: JourneyRunTime

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: A Line is a group of Route which is generally known to the public by a similar name or number.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Line

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Any Mode of Transport
owl:Class.rdfs:label: ModeOfTransport

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: A VehicleJourney that is run under real-time tracking system and so for which real-time observations and predictions and other data are available
owl:Class.rdfs:label: MonitoredVehicleJourney

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: A day of public transport operation of which the characteristics are defined within in a specific ServiceCalendar. An OperatingDay may last more than 24 hours.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: OperatingDay

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: A ParkingPoint where vehicles may stay unattended for a long time. A vehicle's return to the ParkingPoint marks the end of a Block
owl:Class.rdfs:label: ParkingPoint

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: A Passenger is someone who makes a Trip
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Passenger

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Time data concerning public transport vehicles passing a particular Point, e.g. arrival time, departure time, waiting time
owl:Class.rdfs:label: PassingTime

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: A geographic Place of any type which may be specified as the origin or destination of a Trip. A Place may be represented as a Point (dimension 0), a Road section (dimension 1) or a Zone (dimension 2)
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Place

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: A Point is a 0-dimensional Node of the Network used for the spatial description of the network. Point may be located by a Location
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Point

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: A Scheduled Stop Point of Timing Point in a Journey Pattern with its order in that Journey Pattern
owl:Class.rdfs:label: PointInJourneyPattern

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: A specification of Address refining it by using the attributes used for conventional identification for mail. Comprises variously a building identifier, Streeet name, Post Code and other descriptions.
PostalAddress

A place where Passenger have access to Vehicles, taxi, cars or other means of transportation. A Quay may serve one or more VehicleStoppingPlace and be associated with one or more ScheduledStopPoints.
A Quay may contain a subquay.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Quay

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Specialisation of Address refining it by using the characteristics such as road number and mname use for conventional inidentification of along a road
owl:Class.rdfs:label: RoadAddress

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: A Route is and ordered list of located Point defining one single path through the road (or rail) network.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Route

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: A ScheduledStopPoint is a Point where a Passenger can board or alight from a Vehicle.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: ScheduledStopPoint

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: A ServiceJourney is a Passenger carrying VehicleJourney for one specified DayType. The pattern of working is in principle defined by a ServiceJourneyPattern.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: ServiceJourney

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: The Journey Pattern for a passenger carrying Service Journey
owl:Class.rdfs:label: ServiceJourneyPattern

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: A group of ScheduledStopPoint close to each other
owl:Class.rdfs:label: StopArea

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: A place comprising one or more locations where Vehicles may stop and where passengers may board or leave Vehicles or prepare their Trip. A StopPlace will usually have one or more wellknown names.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: StopPlace

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: A Point in Journey Pattern that is a ScheduledStopPoint
owl:Class.rdfs:label: StopPointInJourneyPattern

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: A period in a day, significant for some aspect of public transport, e.g. similar traffic conditions or fare category
owl:Class.rdfs:label: TimeBand

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: An indicator of traffic conditions or other factors which may affect Vehicle Run or Wait times. It may be entered directly by the scheduler or defined by the use of TimeBands.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: TimeDemandType

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Long-term planned time data concerning public transport vehicles passing a particular PointInJourneyPattern on a specified VehicleJourney for a certain DayType
owl:Class.rdfs:label: TimeTabledPassingTime

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: The planned movement of a Public Transport Vehicle on a DayType from the start point to the end point of a JourneyPattern on a specified Route.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: TimetabledVehicleJourney
A TimingLink is an ordered pair of TimingPoint for which run times may be recorded.
TimingLink

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: A TimingLinkInJourneyPattern is the position of a TimingLink in a JourneyPattern. This entity is needed if a TimingLink is repeated in the same JourneyPattern, and separate information is to be stored about each iteration of the TimingLink
owl:Class.rdfs:label: TimingLinkInJourneyPattern

owl:Class.rdfs:comment:
A TimingPoint is a Point against which the timing information necessary to build schedules may be recorded.
It's the same as TimingPointInJourneyPattern
owl:Class.rdfs:label: TimingPoint

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: A Point in a JourneyPattern which is a TimingPoint
owl:Class.rdfs:label: TimingPointInJourneyPattern

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: A type of Place providing the topographical context when searching for or presenting travel information, for example as the origin or destination of a trip. It may be of any size (e.g. County, City, Town, Village) and of different specificity (e.g. Greater London, London, West End, Westimenster, St James)
owl:Class.rdfs:label: TopographicPlace

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: According to the definition of GTFS for Trip the VehicleJourney's Transmodel definition would fit better
In Transmodel is the physical spatial possibility for a passenger to travel from a Place (located Point) origin of the Trip to another place (located Point) destination of the Trip.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Trip

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: TypeOfFlexibleService are: -. Veritual line service - Flexible service with main route - Corridor service - Fixed stop area-wide flexible service - Free area-wide flexible service - Mixed types of flexible service - Mixed type of flexible and regular service
owl:Class.rdfs:label: TypeOfFlexibleService

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: A PublicTransportVehicle used for carrying Passengers
owl:Class.rdfs:label: Vehicle

owl:Class.rdfs:comment:
A Vehicle Journey is the journey made by the Vehicle.
Within VehicleJourney there are three types: - TimetabledVehicleJourney in a general timetable that will run on a specific time on a DayType throughout the period of applicability of the schedule. - DatedVehicleJourney, a specific VehicleJourney that runs on a spcific calendar date; - MonitoredVehicleJourney, a VehicleJourney run under real-time tracking system and so for which real-time observations and predictions and other data are available.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: VehicleJourney

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: The time taken to traverse a specified TimingLinkInJourneyPattern on a specified VehicleJourney. This gives the most detailed control over times and overrides the DefaultServiceJourneyRunTime and JourneyPatternRunTime and the DefaultDeadRunRunTime
owl:Class.rdfs:label: VehicleJourneyRunTime

owl:Class.rdfs:comment:
A place on the vehicle track where vehicles stop in order for passengers to board or alight from a vehicle.
A vehicle track is located on the respective infrastructure link for the mode (railway element of railway network, road element of road network, etc.).
A vehicle stopping place may be served by one or more quays.
owl:Class.rdfs:label: VehicleStoppingPlace

owl:NamedIndividual.rdfs:comment: Concept scheme where all the codelists for the types of journeys that are included in the Transmodel ontology
